results.title: Three Prime Ministers
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Three of the most significant politicians in recent Australian history are interviewed on their visions for Australia in the 21st Century. Gough Whitlam, Malcolm Fraser and Bob Hawke discuss what they see as the most important issues confronting Australia in the 1990’s, including the question of reconciliation between white and black Australians; the importance of trade and cultural links with Asia; the increasingly debilitating effects of permanent unemployment; and the possible consequences of republicanism on Australian identity and notions of statehood. The interviewers on this episode of “Face the Press” are Phillip Adams, Amanda Buckley and Paul Murphy.

results.title: Three preschoolers
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Time to grow”.
Case studies of three preschoolers, one middle class, one a twin in a culturally unfamiliar background, and one blind.

results.title: Three pirates bold
results.creator_credit: Go Pictures, George K. Arthur, Victor Kayfetz and Ilya Tolston
results.brief_description: On the advice of an old sail maker two boys and a dog hunt for treasure on an island in the Bahamas. Discouraged after strenuous but unfruitful digging, they dive for crayfish which they then sell to a local crayfish dealer.

results.title: Three phase motor. Part 1. Preparing to rewind
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Shows how to interpret and record name-plate data of the three-phase motor. Identify the line and finish leads; remove coils and determine coil span; use a coil-winding machine; and end-tape machine wound coils.

results.title: Three men made history
results.creator_credit: British Gas Council, Ace Films, Frank Green and John Miller
results.brief_description: The history of minting money in Great Britain. Special emphasis is laid on the work of Boulton, Watt and Murdock, and contemporary processes are shown in detail. The film has reproductions of ancient coins, with special emphasis on findings in Great Britain. The famous Maundy money distributed yearly by the King is also included.

results.title: Three men and a baby (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort and Leonard Nimoy
results.brief_description: The lives of three confirmed Manhattan bachelors are thrown into confusion when a baby girl is left at their front door. A lively remake of the 1985 French comedy “Three men and a cradle”. Starring Ted Danson, Tom Selleck and Steve Guttenberg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort and Leonard Nimoy

results.title: Three men and a baby
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort and Leonard Nimoy
results.brief_description: Entertaining light-hearted comedy about three bachelors living in a New York apartment whose lives are suddenly and dramatically changed when a baby is left on their doorstep. The three are somewhat challenged in their new role of parenthood and it is the interaction between them that provides most of the humour. Stars Tom Selleck, Steve Guttenberg and Ted Danson in the lead roles with Nancy Travis, Margaret Colin and Celeste Holm.
